questions_answers.question: What type of models does ComfyUI-SegMoE support?
What are the key features of the SegMoE Generation node in ComfyUI-SegMoE?
questions_answers.answer: The key features of the SegMoE Generation node are pipe (model connection), positivet and negative (positive and negative prompt words), step (steps, default is 30), guidance_scale (prompt word relevance, default is 5), width and height (width and height), and seed.

questions_answers.question: How can I install ComfyUI-SegMoE?
questions_answers.answer: You can install ComfyUI-SegMoE using the ComfyUI Manager (soon to be released), or manually by cloning the repository and installing the requirements.

questions_answers.question: What are the prerequisites for running ComfyUI-SegMoE?
questions_answers.answer: It is recommended to have at least 20GB of VRAM to run ComfyUI-SegMoE.

questions_answers.question: What is the typical workflow for using ComfyUI-SegMoE?
questions_answers.answer: The workflow is defined in the [SegMoE V1.0](https://github.com/ZHO-ZHO-ZHO/ComfyUI-SegMoE/blob/main/SEGMOE%20WORKFLOWS/SegMoE%20V1.0%E3%80%90Zho%E3%80%91.json) file.

questions_answers.question: What is the latest version of ComfyUI-SegMoE?
questions_answers.answer: The latest version of ComfyUI-SegMoE is V1.0.

questions_answers.question: What is the speed performance of V1.0 on an A100 GPU?
questions_answers.answer: The V1.0 performance on an A100 GPU for 50 steps is 17 seconds.

questions_answers.question: Who is the primary contributor to the SegMoE model that ComfyUI-SegMoE is based on?
questions_answers.answer: The primary contributor to the SegMoE model is [SegMind](https://github.com/segmind/segmoe).
